text:
Can anyone help me fix this crawl issue?

The <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VkaLPbwbFmk|video in question> is embedded on several of our blog posts so I'm not sure why there's only a error on <https://dispatch.m.io/intercompany-collaboration/|this page>.

Maybe I need to tweak something in WordPress rather than YouTube? I know I need to amend the fields: description and upload date but... where?

text:
Hi Dom.
We use RankMath SEO on our sites, and set the Schema in there.
If you are not using a SEO plugin, then this might work for you: <https://wordpress.org/plugins/meta-tag-manager/>

attachments.title: Meta Tag Manager
attachments.text: Easily add and manage custom meta tags to various parts of your site or on individual posts, such as Yahoo and Google verification tags.

text: At the risk of sounding ignorant... I love everything I read on <http://animalz.co|animalz.co> and I read it often. But given that they describe themselves as devoted to SaaS, how is it that there's virtually no content devoted to SaaS?

elements.text: At the risk of sounding ignorant... I love everything I read on
animalz.co
and I read it often. But given that they describe themselves as devoted to SaaS, how is it that there's virtually no content devoted to SaaS?

text:
Your question is not ignorant at all. 

I think it comes down to how they want to be perceived, aka positioning. They are an up-market agency and want (potential) customers to perceive them as thought leaders in their space, which is why you keep coming back to read their content.

If their tag-line told you _what_ they do (“Animalz provides high-end content marketing solutions to SaaS companies.”), reading their content would show _why_ you should hire them over a competitor.

elements.text: Your question is not ignorant at all.

what
they do (“Animalz provides high-end content marketing solutions to SaaS companies.”), reading their content would show
why
you should hire them over a competitor.

text:
<@U018BH9FT3L> 
Based on your niche, sounds like you want to seek out writers that use the title ‘technical writer’.

You could start by joining communities that cater to technical writers so you can land freelancers. You could start here: <https://github.com/sixhobbits/technical-writing/blob/master/communities.md|https://github.com/sixhobbits/technical-writing/blob/master/communities.md>

attachments.title: sixhobbits/technical-writing
attachments.text: A collection of materials relating to technical writing - sixhobbits/technical-writing

text:
Maybe <@UJ3K7N8GJ> would like to answer this when he's around next :slightly_smiling_face:

From my standpoint, I think it's more worthwhile for our content to be _broadly_ helpful -- to folks in a variety of content roles, at a variety of companies -- rather than only applicable to a small group of people. But I'm not Ryan, so I'm only guessing!

text:
> Do you just give them a creative brief, get the content back, make a few edits, and track it all yourself?
This describes how we operate. Although depending on the project, we might share some keyword data. Generally though, we don’t expect writers to be concerned with any analytics or performance. That’s my job. And it’s our job to translate our research into actionable guidelines in the brief.

elements.text: Do you just give them a creative brief, get the content back, make a few edits, and track it all yourself?

This describes how we operate. Although depending on the project, we might share some keyword data. Generally though, we don’t expect writers to be concerned with any analytics or performance. That’s my job. And it’s our job to translate our research into actionable guidelines in the brief.
